com.adobe.cq.social.forum.client.api

Interface Post<T extends CommentCollectionConfiguration>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the generic type
    All Superinterfaces:
    Comment<T>, SocialCollectionComponent, SocialComponent
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CalendarEvent, IdeaComment, JournalEntryComment, QnaPost
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPost

    public interface Post<T extends CommentCollectionConfiguration>
extends Comment<T>
    The Post represents a topic of a forum, or a post of a topics. The isTopic method indicates whether an instance of a Post is a topic or not.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.adobe.cq.social.commons.comments.api.Comment

        Comment.ModeratorActions, Comment.ModeratorStatus, Comment.Tag

    • Method Detail

      • getSubject

        java.lang.String getSubject()
        This method returns the forum post's subject as entered by the user. In general only top-level posts (topics) have a subject. If the post doesn't have a subject, the subject of top level parent (topic) is returned.
        Returns:
        A String representing the post's subject or null if not defined.

      • getLastModifiedUser

        User getLastModifiedUser()
        Returns the user that effected the last modification of this post.
        Returns:
        A User last modified this post.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Indicates whether this forum or topic is closed for further addition of topics/posts.
        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface Comment<T extends CommentCollectionConfiguration>
        Returns:
        true if this topic is closed.

      • isTopic

        boolean isTopic()
        Check if this instance is a Post or not.
        Returns:
        true if this post is a topic.

      • getForumId

        java.lang.String getForumId()
        Get the forum id for this post.
        Returns:
        the forum id.

      • getLatestPost

        java.lang.String getLatestPost()
        Returns the latest post, i.e. the post with the most recent modification date. If this post is not a topic or doesn't have any posts, null is returned.
        Returns:
        The latest post of this topic or null if not found.

      • getFriendlyUrl

        java.lang.String getFriendlyUrl()
        Gets the friendly url.
        Specified by:
        getFriendlyUrl in interface SocialComponent
        Returns:
        a search engine friendly url to render this post if this post is a topic. if the post is a topic, this is blank.
